sen.j: 東寺駅（とうじえき）は、京都府京都市南区 (京都市）西九条蔵王町にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Nishi-Kujo-Zaocho of Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Toji Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Located in Nishi-Kujo-Zaocho of the Minami ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Toji Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Toji Station, located at Nishi-Kujo-Zaocho in Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Corporation.

sen.j: 現在は特急以外の全ての列車が停車するが、一時期京都線に設定されていた快速急行は通過していた。
sen.e: All trains except those classified "Limited Express" currently stop at this station, but rapid express trains did not stop and overpassed this station when they were at one time in operation..

All trains except those classified as "limited express" currently stop at this station; however, during their time of operation the rapid express trains did not stop at this station but would overpass it instead.

All trains except those classified as limited expresses currently stop at this station; however, during their time of operation the rapid express trains for Kyoto Line did not stop at this station but would overpass it instead.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ高架駅。
sen.e: It is an elevated station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.
It is an elevated station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.
It is an elevated station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: Platforms have an effective length to accommodate six cars.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.

sen.j: 改札・コンコースは1階、ホームは2階にある。
sen.e: Ticket gates and concourse are located on the ground floor and platforms on the floor above.
The ticket gates and concourse are located on the ground floor, and the platforms are on the floor above.
The ticket gates and concourse are located on the ground floor, and the platforms are on the floor above.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみ。
sen.e: Ticket gates are installed at only one place.
Ticket gates are found in only one location.
Ticket gates are found in only one location.

sen.j: 定期券の販売は行われていない。
sen.e: Commutation passes are not sold.
Commuter passes are not sold.
Commuter passes are not sold.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automated ticket gates installed are of Toshiba manufacture.
The automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: Red colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting and PiTaPa Card and ICOCA Card compatible.
The red-colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting, and they're compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.
The red-colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting, and they're compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は9,765人。
sen.e: According to a survey conducted on Nov. 8, 2005, passengers getting on and off at this station numbered 9,765 on that day.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, a total of 9,765 passengers got on and off at this station that day.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, a total of 9,765 passengers got on and off at this station that day.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、77位。
sen.e: Ranked 77th amongst all Kintetsu stations (323 stations on day of survey) subject to survey.
It ranked seventy-seventh among all Kintetsu stations (a total of 323 stations on the day) subject to the survey.
It ranked seventy-seventh among all Kintetsu stations (a total of 323 stations on the day) subject to the survey.

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、14位。
sen.e: Ranked 14th amongst stations on Kyoto Line (26 stations including Yamato-Saidaiji Station.)
It ranked fourteenth among stations on the Kyoto Line (out of 26 stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranked fourteenth among stations on the Kyoto Line (out of 26 stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、12位。
sen.e: Ranked 12th amongst (23) Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked twelfth among 23 Kintetsu stations in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked twelfth among 23 Kintetsu stations in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 最寄停留所は、駅前の国道1号線（九条通り）にある九条近鉄前となる。
sen.e: The nearest bus stop is Kujo Kintetsu-mae located on National Highway Route No.1 (on Kujo-dori Street) in front of the station.
The nearest bus stop is Kujo Kintetsu-mae, located on National Highway Route No. 1 (on Kujo-dori Street) in front of the station.
The nearest bus stop is Kujo Kintetsu-mae, located on National Route 1 (on Kujo-dori Street) in front of the station.
sen.cmt: 国道→National Route [英辞郎on the web]

sen.j: 当停留所が、「近鉄東寺駅前」ではなく「九条近鉄前」と呼称するのは、1978年まで九条通を運行していた京都市電の停留所名を引き継いだためである。
sen.e: The reason why this bus stop is called 'Kujo Kintetsu-mae' and not 'Kintetsu Toji Station-mae' is because it inherited the name of the stop of Kyoto City Trams which were running on Kujo-dori Street up to 1978.

The reason this bus stop is called "Kujo Kintetsu-mae" instead of "Kintetsu Toji Station-mae" is that it inherited the name of the stop of Kyoto City Trams, which ran on Kujo-dori Street up until 1978.

The reason this bus stop is called 'Kujo Kintetsu-mae' instead of 'Kintetsu Toji Station-mae' is that it inherited the name of the stop used by Kyoto City Trams, which ran on Kujo-dori Street up until 1978.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月15日 奈良電気鉄道京都～桃山御陵前駅間開通時に開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated when the section between Kyoto Station and Momoyama Goryo-mae Station of Nara Electric Railway Line became operable on Nov. 15, 1928.
It was inaugurated on November 15, 1928, when the section between Kyoto Station and Momoyama Goryo-mae Station of the Nara Electric Railway Line went into operation.
November 15, 1928: The station was inaugurated when the section between Kyoto Station and Momoyama Goryo-mae Station of the Nara Electric Railway went into operation.

sen.j: 1939年（昭和14年）3月 大和西大寺駅方に0.1km移設し、高架化。
sen.e: Elevated and relocated 0.1km towards Yamato-Saidaiji Station in March 1939.
In March 1939 it was elevated and relocated 0.1 km toward Yamato-Saidaiji Station.
March 1939: The station was elevated and relocated 0.1 km toward Yamato-Saidaiji Station.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kintetsu Corporation station on Oct.1, 1963 as a result of amalgamation.
It became a Kintetsu Corporation station on October 1, 1963, as the result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1963: The station became a Kintetsu Corporation station as the result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: Use of PiTaPa Cards commenced on April 1, 2007.
PiTaPa card usage commenced on April 1, 2007.
April 1, 2007: The use of PiTaPa Cards commenced.
